description:
In collaboration with BioMark project IDFG will provide staff to support PIT array O&M.
 
Biomark and IDFG will work cooperatively in managing O&M for select IDFG PIT Arrays at Lochsa River, N. Fork Salmon River, and Marsh Creek.
 
Biomark will work with IDFG to identify PIT array site owners and first responder staff.  These staff will work with Biomark to conduct an annual operations site assessment and review basic O&M practices for sites based on a PIT array site operations manual to be updated and maintained under the protocol In-Stream PIT tag Detection System (IPTDS) Data Standards v1.0 at https://www.monitoringresources.org/Document/Protocol/Details/2262 .  Biomark will provide an annual training (WebEx or in-person) for IDFG personnel that outlines the basics of array installation, operation, and troubleshooting. Training will also outline minimum field expectations for IDFG field staff.

userSamples.name: BPA Sample for Study Design Duwamish Test Design In-Stream PIT tag Detection System (IPTDS) Data Standards v1.0 WSE 125241 (2875)

title: PIT array operation & maintenance: Marsh Creek, N. Fork Salmon River and Lochsa R - Idaho Department of Fish and Game (IDFG)
